headline.main: Soft-Spoken Heir to Role Of Anti-Arab Militant

lead_paragraph: Soft-spoken and introverted, Binyamin Zeev Kahane seemed an unlikely heir to the virulently anti-Arab legacy of his fiercely outspoken father, Rabbi Meir Kahane. With his slight build and wispy beard, Mr. Kahane lacked the charisma and fiery rhetoric that his father used to attract followers to his crusade to expel Arabs from Israel, the West Bank and the Gaza Strip.
abstract: Binyamin Kahane, soft-spoken and introverted, nevertheless took up his slain father's mantle, promoting Rabbi Meir Kahane's militant ideas in lectures, writings and political activity (M)
